The coach in the video starts with simple kick-and-catch reps and building backspin while staying relaxed and rhythmic outdoors. Then, he corrects power and height and explains the awkward feel of the weaker foot. He also stresses repetition with varied touch sizes as the scene moves indoors. He adds a foot-stall drill to build control strength and demonstrates heading with bent knees and forehead straight up. Finally, he integrates multiple body parts and directional mini- and high-touches for fuller control. This matches option A.
